edu.psu.citeseerx.corecom
Class ObjectServer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      edu.psu.citeseerx.corecom.ObjectServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ByteStreamObjectServer, XStreamObjectServer
public abstract class ObjectServer
extends java.lang.Thread

This class maintains a multi-threaded server architecture for efficiently handling ObjectTransferConnections. A fixed-size thread pool is set up and command objects that will be used to handle incoming messages are pre-cached to minimize object creation overhead. All threads in the thread pool are prestarted.

Nested Class Summary
protected  class ObjectServer.ServiceWorker
          Class for controlling the execution of command objects that handle incoming messages, and hiding communication details from out-of-package users.

Constructor Detail

ObjectServer

public ObjectServer(ServiceCommand command,
                    ConfigurationManager configurationManager)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Open a base ServerSocket at the specified port, initialize thread pool, pre-cache a pool of serviceCommand clones, and then start listening for connections.

Parameters:
command - command object for handling client messages
configurationManager - object for reading configuration.

java.lang.Exception

getConfiguration

public ServerConfiguration getConfiguration()
Returns the configuration for this ObjectServer.

Returns:

run

public void run()
Readies cached ServiceWorkers and submits them to the thread pool to handle incoming requests. Requests are first wrapped as ObjectTransferConnections before the root ObjectServer thread relinquishes control.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

startWorker

protected abstract void startWorker(ObjectServer.ServiceWorker worker,
                                    java.net.Socket socket,
                                    int compressedBlockSize)
Subclasses must override to provide the correct initializer for raw sockets accepted from client connections.

Parameters:
worker - a ServiceWorker that will use the specified socket
socket - raw socket accepted from server

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Sets the shutdown flag so no new clients will be accepted or threads started, then shuts down the threadPool gracefully and closes the ServerSocket.

isShutdown

public boolean isShutdown()
Returns:
whether this server is in a shutdown state.
